page.title: 01CHIRNSIDE:SUMMARY
page.content: The area we are investigating is part of rural Berwickshire. It lies 9 miles west of Berwick-upon-Tweed. The population is around 1200 and includes the 2 villages of Chirnside and Allanton. There is a very limited public bus service, most people having to rely on their own forms of transport, so getting about is not easy. Sixteen shops serve the community, the most important being the Post Offices. Steady employment is provided mainly by farms, a paper mill, grain stores, and shops. Children from a wide area attend the local primary school at Chirnside. For a small area there is a variety of activities for people to enjoy, including many indoor and outdoor sports. The Civic Week is held annually with fun and games for all the family.
